data.name: CannotFindJobDefinition
data.value: Cannot find scheduled job {0}.
data.comment: {0} is the scheduled job definition name that cannot be found.

data.name: CannotFindTaskId
data.value: Cannot find scheduled job definition {0} in the Task Scheduler.

data.name: CannotRemoveTaskRunningInstance
data.value: The scheduled job definition {0} cannot be removed because one or more instances are currently running. You can remove and stop all running instances by using the Force parameter.

data.name: CantAddJobTriggersToDefinition
data.value: An error occurred while adding triggers to the scheduled job {0}.

data.name: CantFindInWTS
data.value: There is no entry in Task Scheduler for scheduled job definition {0}. A new Task Scheduler entry has been created for this scheduled job definition.

data.name: CantLoadDefinitionFromStore
data.value: Cannot get the {0} scheduled job because it is corrupted or in an irresolvable state. Because it cannot run, PowerShell has deleted {0} and its results from the computer. To recreate the scheduled job, use the Register-ScheduledJob cmdlet. For more information about corrupted scheduled jobs, see about_Scheduled_Jobs_Troubleshooting.
data.comment: {0} is the name of the scheduled job definition.

data.name: CantLoadJobRunFromStore
data.value: An error occurred while loading job run results for scheduled job {0} with job run date {1}.

data.name: CantRegisterJobDefinition
data.value: An error occurred while registering the scheduled job {0}.

data.name: CantRemoveTriggersFromDefinition
data.value: An error occurred while removing job triggers from scheduled job {0}.

data.name: CantRetrieveJobRuns
data.value: One or more scheduled job runs could not be retrieved {0}.

data.name: CantSaveJobNoFilePathSpecified
data.value: Job {0} cannot be saved because no file path was specified.

data.name: CantSaveJobNotRun
data.value: Job {0} has not been run and cannot be saved. Run the job first, and then save results.

data.name: CantSetEnableOnJobDefinition
data.value: An error occurred while enabling or disabling the scheduled job {0}.

data.name: CantSetJobDefinition
data.value: An error occurred while setting properties on the scheduled job {0}.

data.name: CantStartJobDefinition
data.value: Cannot start a job from the {0} scheduled job definition.

data.name: CantUnregisterDefinition
data.value: An error occurred while unregistering the scheduled job {0}.

data.name: CantUpdateTriggerOnJobDef
data.value: An error occurred while updating the scheduled job definition {0} with this trigger {1}. See exception details for more information.

data.name: ConflictingTypeParams
data.value: Only one JobTrigger type can be specified: AtStartup, AtLogon, Once, Daily, or Weekly.

data.name: DefinitionAlreadyExistsInLocal
data.value: A scheduled job definition object {0} already exists in the local scheduled job repository having this Global ID {1}.

data.name: DefinitionNotFoundByGlobalId
data.value: A scheduled job definition object with Global ID {0} could not be found.

data.name: DefinitionNotFoundById
data.value: A scheduled job definition with ID {0} could not be found.

data.name: DefinitionNotFoundByName
data.value: A scheduled job definition with Name {0} could not be found.

data.name: DefinitionObjectDisposed
data.value: This scheduled job definition object {0} has been disposed.

data.name: DefinitionWhatIf
data.value: Scheduled job definition {0}.

data.name: DirectoryNotFoundError
data.value: A directory not found error occurred while registering scheduled job definition {0}. Make sure you are running PowerShell with elevated privileges.

data.name: ErrorRegisteringDefinitionStore
data.value: An error occurred while registering scheduled job definition {0}. Cannot add this definition object to the job store.

data.name: ErrorRegisteringDefinitionTask
data.value: An error occurred while registering scheduled job definition {0} to the Windows Task Scheduler. The Task Scheduler error is: {1}.

data.name: ErrorRemovingDefinitionStore
data.value: An error occurred while unregistering scheduled job definition {0}.

data.name: ErrorSettingAccessPermissions
data.value: An error occurred while setting file access permissions for job definition {0} and user {1}.

data.name: ErrorUpdatingDefinitionStore
data.value: An error occurred while updating scheduled job definition {0}. Cannot update this definition in the job store.

data.name: ErrorUpdatingDefinitionTask
data.value: An error occurred while updating scheduled job definition {0}. Cannot update this definition with the Windows Task Scheduler.

data.name: GeneralWTSError
data.value: An error has occurred within the Task Scheduler.

data.name: InvalidAtTime
data.value: The At parameter is not valid for the {0} job trigger type.

data.name: InvalidDaysInterval
data.value: The DaysInterval parameter is not valid for the {0} job trigger type.

data.name: InvalidDaysIntervalParam
data.value: The DaysInterval parameter value must be greater than zero.

data.name: InvalidDaysOfWeek
data.value: The DaysOfWeek parameter is not valid for the {0} job trigger type.

data.name: InvalidFilePath
data.value: The FilePath parameter is not valid.

data.name: InvalidFilePathFile
data.value: Only PowerShell script files are allowed for FilePath parameter. Specify a file with .ps1 extension.

data.name: InvalidIdleDuration
data.value: The IdleDuration parameter cannot have a negative value.

data.name: InvalidIdleTimeout
data.value: The IdleTimeout parameter cannot have a negative value.

data.name: InvalidJobDefName
data.value: The scheduled job definition name {0} contains characters that are not valid.

data.name: InvalidMaxResultCount
data.value: The MaxResultCount parameter cannot have a negative or zero value.

data.name: InvalidUser
data.value: The User parameter is not valid for the {0} job trigger type.

data.name: InvalidWeeksInterval
data.value: The WeeksInterval parameter is not valid for the {0} job trigger type.

data.name: InvalidWeeksIntervalParam
data.value: The WeeksInterval parameter value must be greater than zero.

data.name: IOFailureOnSetJobDefinition
data.value: An I/O failure occurred while updating the scheduled job definition {0}. This could mean a file is missing or corrupted, either in Task Scheduler or in the PowerShell scheduled job store. You might need to create the scheduled job definition again.
data.comment: {0} is the scheduled job definition name

data.name: JobAlreadyRunning
data.value: Job {0} is currently running.

data.name: JobDefFileAlreadyExists
data.value: The scheduled job definition {0} already exists in the job definition store.

data.name: JobRunResultsFileAlreadyExists
data.value: The scheduled job results {0} already exist in the job results store.

data.name: MissingAtTime
data.value: The At parameter is required for the {0} job trigger type.

data.name: MissingDaysOfWeek
data.value: The DaysOfWeek parameter is required for the {0} job trigger type.

data.name: MissingJobTriggerDaysOfWeek
data.value: The job trigger {0} requires the DaysOfWeek parameter to be defined.

data.name: MissingJobTriggerTime
data.value: The Job trigger {0} requires the At parameter to be defined.

data.name: MissingJobTriggerType
data.value: No Frequency type has been specified for this job trigger. One of the following job trigger frequencies must be specified: AtStartup, AtLogon, Once, Daily, Weekly.

data.name: NoAccessOnSetJobDefinition
data.value: An access denied error occurred while updating the scheduled job definition {0}. Try running PowerShell with elevated user rights; that is, Run as Administrator.
data.comment: {0} is the scheduled job definition name

data.name: NoAssociatedJobDefinitionForOption
data.value: There is no scheduled job definition object associated with this options object.

data.name: NoAssociatedJobDefinitionForTrigger
data.value: There is no scheduled job definition object associated with this trigger {0}.

data.name: ScheduledJobAlreadyExistsInLocal
data.value: The scheduled job {0} already exists in the local repository.

data.name: ScheduledJobNotInRepository
data.value: The scheduled job {0} is not in the local job repository.

data.name: TaskIdAlreadyExists
data.value: The scheduled job definition {0} already exists in Task Scheduler.

data.name: TriggerDailyType
data.value: Daily

data.name: TriggerLogonType
data.value: AtLogon

data.name: TriggerNotFound
data.value: A scheduled job trigger with ID {0} was not found for the scheduled job definition {1}.

data.name: TriggerOnceType
data.value: Once

data.name: TriggerStartUpType
data.value: AtStartup

data.name: TriggerWeeklyType
data.value: Weekly

data.name: UnauthorizedAccessError
data.value: An access denied error occurred when registering scheduled job definition {0}. Try running PowerShell with elevated user rights; that is, Run As Administrator.

data.name: UnknownTriggerFrequency
data.value: Cannot convert a ScheduledJobTrigger object with TriggerFrequency value of {0}.

data.name: UnknownTriggerType
data.value: An unknown trigger type was returned from Task Scheduler for scheduled job definition {0} with trigger ID {1}.

data.name: CannotSerializeData
data.value: The scheduled job definition {0} could not be saved because one of the values in the ArgumentList parameter cannot be converted to XML. If possible, change the ArgumentList values to types that are easily converted to XML, such as strings, integers, and hash tables. {1}
data.comment: {0} is the name of the scheduled job definition that cannot be registered {1} is the inner exception message from .Net serialization, or empty if no exception message.

data.name: UnsupportedHostFunction
data.value: Commands that interact with the host program, such as Write-Host, cannot be included in PowerShell scheduled jobs because scheduled jobs do not interact with the host program. Use an alternate command that does not interact with the host program, such as Write-Output or Out-File.

data.name: InvalidRepetitionInterval
data.value: The RepetitionInterval parameter value must be less than or equal to the RepetitionDuration parameter value.

data.name: InvalidRepetitionIntervalValue
data.value: The RepetitionInterval parameter value must be greater than 1 minute.

data.name: InvalidRepetitionParams
data.value: The RepetitionInterval and RepetitionDuration Job trigger parameters must be specified together.

data.name: InvalidRepetitionParamValues
data.value: The Repetition parameters cannot have negative values.

data.name: InvalidSetTriggerRepetition
data.value: The Repetition parameters are not valid for the {0} job trigger type.

data.name: MismatchedRepetitionParamValues
data.value: The RepetitionInterval parameter cannot have a value of zero unless the RepetitionDuration parameter also has a zero value. A zero value removes repetition behavior from the Job trigger.

data.name: ErrorRenamingScheduledJob
data.value: An error occurred while attempting to rename scheduled job from {0} to {1}.

data.name: ErrorRenamingScheduledJobWithMessage
data.value: An error occurred while attempting to rename scheduled job from {0} to {1} with error message: {2}.

data.name: BrokenRenamingScheduledJob
data.value: An unrecoverable error occurred while renaming the scheduled job from {0} to {1}. The scheduled job will be removed.

data.name: BrokenRenamingScheduledJobWithMessage
data.value: An unrecoverable error occurred while renaming the scheduled job from {0} to {1} with message {2}. The scheduled job will be removed.

data.name: ErrorRunningAsTask
data.value: An error occurred while running scheduled job definition {0} from the Task Scheduler.

data.name: ErrorRunningAsTaskWithReason
data.value: An error occurred while running scheduled job definition {0} from the Task Scheduler because {1}.

data.name: InvalidRepeatIndefinitelyParams
data.value: You cannot specify the RepetitionDuration and RepeatIndefinitely parameters in the same command.

data.name: InvalidRepetitionRepeatParams
data.value: When you use the RepeatIndefinitely parameter, the RepetitionInterval parameter is required.

data.name: reasonJobNotFound
data.value: the scheduled job definition could not be found

data.name: ReasonTaskDisabled
data.value: the scheduled job definition is disabled
